dc_title_s: Transportation and Employment, TRIC Subregion, Boston, Massachusetts, 1998 (Raster Image)
dc_description_s: This layer is a georeferenced raster image of the historic paper map entitled: 1998 TRIC subregional special project : transportation and employment, produced by the Metropolitan Area Planning Council GIS Lab. It was published by Metropolitan Area Planning Council in 1998. Scale 1:35,000. Covers the Three Rivers Interlocal Council (Three Rivers) communities including: Needham, Canton, Dedham, Milton, Dover, Medfield, Westwood, Norwood, Walpole, Sharon, Stoughton, and Foxborough, Massachusetts. The image inside the map neatline is georeferenced to the surface of the earth and fit to the Massachusetts State Plane Coordinate System, Mainland Zone (in Feet) (Fipszone 2001). All map collar and inset information is also available as part of the raster image, including any inset maps, profiles, statistical tables, directories, text, illustrations, index maps, legends, or other information associated with the principal map. This map shows features such as drainage, cities and other human settlements, roads, railroads, town boundaries, and more. Shows also traffic counts, places of employment concentration, and zoning district categories.This layer is part of a selection of digitally scanned and georeferenced historic maps from the Harvard Map Collection. These maps typically portray both natural and manmade features. The selection represents a range of originators, ground condition dates, scales, and map purposes.
